intro: Aster inuloides, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silvery-blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall, creating a striking visual effect in gardens. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Aster inuloides is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
